predictions.text: From 2025-09-19 close to 2025-10-31 close, Intel (INTC) will outperform iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) by at least 3.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Yahoo Finance adjusted close for INTC and SOXX. Compute percent change from 2025-09-19 close to 2025-10-31 close. If (PctChange_INTL - PctChange_SOXX) >= 3.0 percentage points, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Analyst rating/target changes on INTC and semiconductor peers
Details or milestones in Nvidia–Intel collaboration
Sector flows into/out of semis ETFs (SOXX, SMH)
Headlines on China AI chip restrictions affecting competitors
Relative strength charts INTC vs SOXX
predictions.rationale: Partnership momentum, sentiment rotation toward diversified foundry/packaging exposure, and potential China-related headwinds for peers support near-term INTC relative outperformance.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, Netskope (NTSK) will close at or above its IPO price on at least 10 trading days since listing (counting from 2025-09-18 to 2025-10-31, Nasdaq trading days).
predictions.verification_criteria: Obtain NTSK IPO price from the company press release or Nasdaq IPO summary. Count Nasdaq trading days from 2025-09-18 through 2025-10-31 where adjusted close >= IPO price. If count >= 10, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Lockup terms and insider selling disclosures
Cybersecurity peer earnings/guidance (PANW, CRWD, ZS)
IPO market breadth and aftermarket performance indices
Daily trading volume and intraday volatility in NTSK
Sell-side initiation coverage and price targets
predictions.rationale: Strong IPO reception and secular AI-driven security demand should sustain aftermarket support despite broader risk swings.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, Google or PayPal will announce a live U.S. retailer pilot enabling AI agent–guided shopping with checkout via PayPal/Braintree in Chrome, Search, or Shopping, via an official blog post or press release naming the retailer.
predictions.verification_criteria: A dated Google or PayPal official blog/press release by 2025-10-31 that explicitly names a U.S. retailer and describes a live (not future/planned) pilot where an AI agent initiates shopping flow and completes checkout using PayPal/Braintree on a Google surface.
monitoring_signals: Google/PayPal developer docs or SDK updates referencing agentic checkout
Retail partner leaks or case studies
Mentions during conferences or earnings calls
Chrome feature flags rollouts and user availability
Merchant adoption signals in PayPal/Braintree merchant updates
predictions.rationale: Aligned incentives and public partnership reveal suggest a near-term pilot to showcase agentic commerce capabilities.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the U.S. 10Y–2Y Treasury yield spread (FRED: DGS10 minus DGS2) will be at or above -0.10 percentage points on at least one trading day.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using FRED daily series DGS10 and DGS2, compute DGS10 - DGS2 each business day through 2025-10-31. If any day’s spread >= -0.10 percentage points, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Fed communications and dot-path interpretations
Inflation data (CPI/PCE) surprises
Treasury auction bid-to-covers and tailing
Risk sentiment (VIX) and oil price trajectory
Labor market prints affecting front-end rates
predictions.rationale: Post-cut dynamics favor partial dis-inversion via front-end repricing and term premium variability.

predictions.text: The Drewry World Container Index Shanghai–New York weekly spot rate published on or before 2025-10-31 will be at least 15% higher than the 2025-09-05 reading.
predictions.verification_criteria: Compare Drewry WCI Shanghai–New York USD/FEU rate on 2025-09-05 to the highest weekly reading published up to 2025-10-31. If increase >= 15% [(new/old - 1) >= 0.15], resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Carrier blank sailings and GRIs on transpacific East Coast routes
Red Sea rerouting impacts and Panama Canal constraints
U.S. East Coast port congestion metrics
Bunker fuel prices and surcharges
Freight booking platform spot quotes
predictions.rationale: Peak-season demand, rerouting, and capacity management should keep upward pressure on East Coast spot rates.

predictions.text: Euro area flash HICP headline inflation (YoY) for September 2025 will be between 2.3% and 2.7% in Eurostat’s 2025-09-30 release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check Eurostat’s flash HICP news release on 2025-09-30 for the euro area all-items HICP YoY. If the value is within [2.3%, 2.7%], inclusive, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Country CPI flashes (Germany, Spain, France, Italy)
Energy price developments (Brent, natural gas)
Euro exchange rate pass-through
Wage growth and negotiated pay data
PMIs and services inflation components
predictions.rationale: Disinflation trend continues with energy base effects moderating; services inflation remains sticky but easing.

predictions.text: U.S. Advance Retail and Food Services sales month-over-month for September 2025 will be between -0.2% and +0.5% in the Census release on 2025-10-16.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the headline m/m percentage change in the U.S. Census Advance Monthly Retail Trade report released 2025-10-16. If value ∈ [-0.2%, +0.5%], inclusive, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Bank card spending trackers (BAC, JPM) and Redbook
Auto SAAR and gasoline sales volumes
Back-to-school seasonal effects
Online sales trends (Adobe Digital Economy Index)
Consumer confidence and labor market prints
predictions.rationale: Consumer momentum is mixed: services resilience offsets goods softness; gas prices add volatility.

predictions.text: Tokyo CPI excluding fresh food (core) year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 2.3% and 2.7% in the release due by 2025-10-04 (JST).
predictions.verification_criteria: Check the Statistics Bureau of Japan release for Tokyo CPI ‘All items less fresh food’ YoY for September 2025. If within [2.3%, 2.7%], inclusive, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Utility tariff adjustments and fuel pass-throughs
Yen exchange rate vs USD and import prices
Services inflation components
BOJ commentary on inflation drivers
Base effects from prior-year data
predictions.rationale: Core inflation is easing but remains above BOJ’s target; currency and energy dynamics keep it elevated.

predictions.text: UK GfK Consumer Confidence index for October 2025 will be at or above -12 in the release due by 2025-10-25.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the GfK UK Consumer Confidence monthly press release for October 2025. If the reported headline index is >= -12, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Mortgage rates and housing market indicators
Energy bills and Ofgem price cap dynamics
Labor market data (unemployment, wage growth)
Fiscal policy announcements and tax changes
Equity market performance influencing wealth effects
predictions.rationale: Falling inflation and potential BoE easing support a gradual recovery in sentiment.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly U.S. Field Production of Crude Oil will reach at or above 13.4 million barrels per day in at least one report for a week ending by 2025-10-25, published by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report or series WCRFPUS2. If any weekly data point for week ending on or before 2025-10-25 is >= 13.4 mb/d in a report published by 2025-10-31, resolve True.
monitoring_signals: Rig counts and frac spread counts
Permian productivity and DUC trends
Hurricane or maintenance disruptions
WTI price levels influencing activity
Pipeline takeaway and midstream updates
predictions.rationale: Near-record output and incremental productivity gains make a marginal new high plausible barring disruptions.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, OFAC will announce at least one sanctions designation under its Venezuela-related program via public press release or sanctions list update.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm a U.S. Treasury (OFAC) press release or Recent Actions update dated by 2025-10-31 that adds at least one SDN entry under the Venezuela program identifiers.
monitoring_signals: U.S.–Venezuela diplomatic developments and election-related milestones
Oil sanctions waivers and licensing changes
Regional security or corruption cases tied to Venezuela
Congressional statements urging sanctions
OFAC cadence of weekly updates
predictions.rationale: OFAC actions against Venezuela entities remain frequent amid shifting oil licensing and political timelines.
